support_summary: TDP-43 can be cleaved by caspases, including Caspase-3, at several sites. This cleavage generates C-terminal fragments that are prone to aggregation and are a key feature of TDP-43 pathology in disease.

functions.cellular_process: Overexpression of TDP-43 alters the transcriptional regulation of key apoptosis-related genes in the Bcl-2 family.
functions.effect_description: TDP-43 enhances the promoter activity and mRNA expression of the pro-apoptotic protein Bim, while decreasing the mRNA and protein levels of the anti-apoptotic protein Bcl-xL. This shift in the balance of Bcl-2 family proteins promotes the activation of the apoptotic cascade.
biological_consequence: TDP-43 overexpression → Increased Bim / Decreased Bcl-xL → Mitochondrial outer membrane permeabilization → Caspase activation → Apoptotic cell death
specific_effects: A 2-5 fold increase in TDP-43 expression is sufficient to induce death in neuronal cells.
Silencing Bim expression with siRNA can attenuate TDP-43-induced cell death.
Caspase-mediated cleavage of TDP-43 may be a feedback mechanism to attenuate its toxicity, as the resulting fragments are less potent at inducing cell death.

evidence.paper_title: TDP-43-induced death is associated with altered regulation of BIM and Bcl-xL and attenuated by caspase-mediated TDP-43 cleavage

mechanism: During cellular stress and apoptosis, activated caspases, including Caspase-3, can cleave full-length TDP-43 at specific sites. Overexpression of TDP-43 alters the transcriptional regulation of key apoptosis-related genes in the Bcl-2 family.
effect: This cleavage generates several C-terminal fragments (CTFs) of TDP-43, most notably a ~25 kDa fragment. These CTFs lack the nuclear localization signal, are highly prone to aggregation, and are a major component of the pathological inclusions found in patient neurons, representing a key step in TDP-43 pathology.; TDP-43 enhances the promoter activity and mRNA expression of the pro-apoptotic protein Bim, while decreasing the mRNA and protein levels of the anti-apoptotic protein Bcl-xL. This shift in the balance of Bcl-2 family proteins promotes the activation of the apoptotic cascade.
summary: TDP43 activates Caspase-3 to regulate tdp-43 cleavage and apoptosis, ultimately affecting cellular toxicity.
